sen.j: 源厳子（みなもと の たけこ/げんし、生年不詳－元慶3年6月26日 (旧暦)（879年7月19日））は、清和天皇の女御。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Genshi (aka Takeko, year of birth unknown - July 19, 879) was nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court (a consort of an emperor)) of Emperor Seiwa.

sen.j: 文徳天皇の皇孫で、父は右大臣源能有。
sen.e: She was an imperial descendant of Emperor Montoku, and her father was Minister of the Right, MINAMOTO no Yoshiari.

She was an imperial descendant of Emperor Montoku, and her father was Udaijin (Minister of the Right) MINAMOTO no Yoshiari.

sen.j: 母は藤原滋子（藤原基経女という説があるが未詳）。
sen.e: Her mother was FUJIWARA no Shigeko (there is an assumption that her mother was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Mototsune, details of which are unknown).

sen.j: 温明殿女御と呼ばれた。
sen.e: She was called Unmeiden no nyogo.

sen.j: 貞観 (日本)13年（871年）12月16日に内侍司源全姫の六十の賀に毘廬遮那仏の図絵を作り功徳を修した（『菅家文草』に菅原道真が厳子のために書いた文章が残る）。
sen.e: On December 16, 871, she obtained kudoku (merit) by painting Birushanabutsu at the celebration of sixtieth birthday of Naishi no tsukasa (female palace attendant) MINAMOTO no Matahime (writings made for Genshi by SUGAWARA no Michizane are left in "Kanke Bunso").

On December 16, 871, she obtained kudoku (merit) by painting Birushanabutsu at the celebration of sixtieth birthday of Naishi no tsukasa (female palace attendant) MINAMOTO no Matahime (writings made for Genshi by SUGAWARA no Michizane are left in "Kanke Bunso").

On February 2, 872, she obtained kudoku (merit) by painting Birushanabutsu (Vairocana-Buddha) at the celebration of 60th birthday of Naishi no tsukasa (female palace attendant) MINAMOTO no Matahime (writings made for Genshi by SUGAWARA no Michizane are left in "Kanke Bunso" (a collection of Chinese poetry created by Sugawara no Michizane)).

sen.j: 元慶3年（879年）3月、清和上皇の勅によって季料月俸が停止された。
sen.e: In March 879, kika geppo (salary) was stopped by an imperial order of the retired Emperor Seiwa.

sen.j: 同年6月、散事（職掌のない後宮職員）従四位下にて卒去。
sen.e: In June of the same year, she passed away in Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) without a government post.
